snippet: Changing oil according to manufacturer recommendations could lower California motor-oil demand by an estimated 10 million gallons annually, according to a state-financed survey.
abstract: Changing oil according to manufacturer recommendations could lower California motor-oil demand by an estimated 10 million gallons annually, according to a state-financed survey.
lead_paragraph: A California agency is campaigning to get car owners to change their motor oil at a longer interval, claiming that the time-honored practice of switching the oil every 3,000 miles is financially wasteful, detrimental to the environment and unwarranted.

headline.main: California Urges Drivers to Change the Oil Less Often
